main event: A bright, round object the size of a pinhead was observed by naval officers on the USS Lansing in the Pacific Ocean.
interesting points: The object was as bright as a first magnitude star and appeared white with no tail.
The object was first observed directly overhead and then disappeared at an elevation of degrees on a bearing of 025 true.
The object passed overhead from west-southwest to east-northeast with no deviation from a straight course before disappearing into clouds.
The object remained in sight for 5 minutes and was observed using binoculars.
The observers included the Commanding Officer, Executive Officer, and Officer of the Deck of the USS Lansing.
sighted object: a bright, round object the size of a pinhead
witnesses: naval officers on the USS Lansing
